ca.eandb.jmist.math

Class MatrixBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.eandb.jmist.math.MatrixBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class MatrixBuffer
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Mutable element-storage for a two-dimensional matrix.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MatrixBuffer

        public MatrixBuffer(double[] elements,
                    int rows,
                    int cols,
                    int offset,
                    int rowStride,
                    int colStride)
        Creates a new MatrixBuffer.
        Parameters:
        elements - The array of doubles containing the elements of the matrix (must be large enough so that the index of the last element [offset + (rows-1) * rowStride + (cols-1) * colStride] is in the array).
        rows - The number of rows in the matrix (must be non-negative).
        cols - The number of columns in the matrix (must be non-negative).
        offset - The offset into elements of the first element of the matrix (must be non-negative).
        rowStride - The difference between the indices into elements of the first element of the first row and the first element of the second row.
        colStride - The difference between the indices into elements of the first element of the first column and the first element of the second column.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if offset is negative.
        IllegalArgumentException - if rows or cols is negative.
        IllegalArgumentException - if elements is not large enough to hold all elements of the array).

      • at

        public double at(int row,
                 int col)
        Gets the element at the specified position in this MatrixBuffer.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the element to obtain (must be non-negative and less than this.rows()).
        col - The column of the element to obtain (must be non-negative and less than this.columns()).
        Returns:
        The element at the specified row and column in this MatrixBuffer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if row or col is out of bounds.
        See Also:
        rows(), columns()

      • set

        public MatrixBuffer set(int row,
                        int col,
                        double value)
        Sets the element at the specified position in this MatrixBuffer.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the element to obtain (must be non-negative and less than this.rows()).
        col - The column of the element to obtain (must be non-negative and less than this.columns()).
        value - The value to set the specified element to.
        Returns:
        A reference to this MatrixBuffer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if row or col is out of bounds.
        See Also:
        rows(), columns()

      • add

        public MatrixBuffer add(int row,
                        int col,
                        double value)
        Adds to the element at the specified position in this MatrixBuffer.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the element to obtain (must be non-negative and less than this.rows()).
        col - The column of the element to obtain (must be non-negative and less than this.columns()).
        value - The value to add to the specified element.
        Returns:
        A reference to this MatrixBuffer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if row or col is out of bounds.
        See Also:
        rows(), columns()

      • transpose

        public MatrixBuffer transpose()
        Gets the transpose of this MatrixBuffer (i.e., the MatrixBuffer T such that this.at(i, j) == T.at(j, i) for all i, j with 0 <= i < this.rows() and 0 <= j < this.columns().
        Returns:
        The transpose of this MatrixBuffer.
        See Also:
        at(int, int), rows(), columns()

      • slice

        public MatrixBuffer slice(int row,
                          int col,
                          int rows,
                          int cols)
        Gets a view of a sub-matrix of this MatrixBuffer (i.e.,
        Parameters:
        row - The index of the first row of the sub-matrix (must be non-negative).
        col - The index of the first column of the sub-matrix (must be non-negative).
        rows - The number of rows of the sub-matrix (must be non-negative and satisfy row + rows <= this.rows()).
        cols - The number of columns of the sub-matrix (must be non-negative and satisfy col + cols <= this.columns()).
        Returns:
        The MatrixBuffer, T, with rows rows and cols columns satisfying T.at(i, j) == this.at(row + i, col + j) for all i, j with 0 <= i < rows and 0 <= j < cols.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if row is negative, col is negative, rows is negative, cols is negative, row + rows > this.rows(), or col + cols > this.columns().
        See Also:
        at(int, int), rows(), columns()

      • diagonal

        public MatrixBuffer diagonal()
        Gets a column vector of the diagonal elements of this MatrixBuffer (i.e., the elements this.at(i, i) for 0 <= i < Math.min(this.rows(), this.columns())).
        Returns:
        The column vector of the diagonal elements of this MatrixBuffer.
        See Also:
        at(int, int), Math.min(int, int)

      • row

        public MatrixBuffer row(int row)
        Gets the specified row of this MatrixBuffer.
        Parameters:
        row - The row to get (must be non-negative and less than this.rows()).
        Returns:
        The specified row of this MatrixBuffer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if row is negative or if row >= this.rows().
        See Also:
        rows()

      • column

        public MatrixBuffer column(int col)
        Gets the specified column of this MatrixBuffer.
        Parameters:
        col - The column to get (must be non-negative and less than this.columns()).
        Returns:
        The specified column of this MatrixBuffer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if col is negative or if col >= this.columns().
        See Also:

      • columnMajor

        public static MatrixBuffer columnMajor(int rows,
                                       int cols,
                                       double[] elements)
        Creates a MatrixBuffer with the specified values in column-major order.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the MatrixBuffer (must be non-negative).
        cols - The number of columns in the MatrixBuffer (must be non-negative).
        elements - The elements of the MatrixBuffer in column-major order (must have at least rows * cols elements -- additional elements will be ignored).
        Returns:
        The rows by cols MatrixBuffer consisting of the elements specified.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if elements.length < rows * cols.
        IllegalArgumentException - if rows or cols is negative.

      • columnMajor

        public static MatrixBuffer columnMajor(int rows,
                                       int cols)
        Creates a MatrixBuffer with values arranged in column-major order.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the MatrixBuffer (must be non-negative).
        cols - The number of columns in the MatrixBuffer (must be non-negative).
        Returns:
        A MatrixBuffer for a rows by cols matrix.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if rows or cols is negative.

      • rowMajor

        public static MatrixBuffer rowMajor(int rows,
                                    int cols,
                                    double[] elements)
        Creates a MatrixBuffer with the specified values in row-major order.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the MatrixBuffer (must be non-negative).
        cols - The number of columns in the MatrixBuffer (must be non-negative).
        elements - The elements of the MatrixBuffer in row-major order (must have at least rows * cols elements -- additional elements will be ignored).
        Returns:
        The rows by cols MatrixBuffer consisting of the elements specified.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if elements.length < rows * cols.
        IllegalArgumentException - if rows or cols is negative.

      • rowMajor

        public static MatrixBuffer rowMajor(int rows,
                                    int cols)
        Creates a MatrixBuffer with values arranged in row-major order.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the MatrixBuffer (must be non-negative).
        cols - The number of columns in the MatrixBuffer (must be non-negative).
        Returns:
        A MatrixBuffer for a rows by cols matrix.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if rows or cols is negative.
